Jonathan Chia Guangrong, Fund Manager at JCG FundLevel 6. MasterAnswered on 21 Apr 2019By investing in options I'd assume you are buying options. Yes it's cheaper than stocks but you will only make money if you are absolutely, 100% sure about the direction the stock will take by the time it's near the option expiry. Do note that option premiums decay due to the time value and it will lower the value of your positions every moment you are not right. 80% of options expire worthless so you need to factor this as well. Consider selling options instead for more consistent returns. Best to find someone to teach you this as there can be unlimited liability involved if you don't know what you are doing0 comments1
